availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, tobacconist. Providence, Rhode Island, native. Son of John Cleveland Cady and Lucy Morris Nichols Cady. Married to Mary Ann Duncan Cady in Mason County, Kentucky, on November 21, 1848. Father of Charles C. Cady, Lucy Cady, William Cady, and Mattie Cady. Tobacconist in Maysville in 1850. Tobacconist in Maysville in 1860. Tobacconist in Maysville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District , p. 33B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville 1st Ward, p. 293.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, 1796-1946, Film #000281843, p. 81.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 9th Congressional District, Vol. 3, October 1863, p. 26, p. 29 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on May 19, 2020).
Find A Grave, "CPT Charles Gustavus Cady (1821-1900)," Memorial 128446397, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/128446397 (accessed May 19, 2020).
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970. Cincinnati, Ohio: National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution. Application for Phillip Edson (Cady) Lawwill, Microfilm, volume 254, p. 71 of microfilm (accessed through Ancestry.com on May 19, 2020).
